pageTitle: TF2/Creating a Payload Map - Valve Developer Community
textBeforeTable: Create a logic_auto entity and select the outputs tab. Create a tf_gamerules and name it GameRules. For this tutorial there is only 1 round but has been made with other rounds in mind. Game Rules and Logic Setting up the round 9 See also 8 Conclusion 7.3.1 Timeline 7.3 Final Explosion 7.2.3 Barrels in Pit 7.2.2 Doors to Pit 7.2.1 Pit Model 7.2 Explode Pit 7.1 Final Capture Point 7 Final Terminus 6.4 Capture Bell 6.3 Sparks 6.2 Flashing Light 6.1 Dispenser Beam 6 Additional Effects 5 Train Watcher 4.2 End point cap 4.1 Mid point cap 4 Adding a Capture Point 3 Building the Track
textAfterTable: Property Name Description Value Name Name of the entity CP_Master Start Disabled Self-explanatory No Cap Layout Self-explanatory Restrict team from winning Self-explanatory Red Switch teams on map win? Self-explanatory Yes Scoring Style Self-explanatory Add team score for each captured point Play all rounds before changelevel Self-explanatory Only changelevel after all mini-rounds have been played to completion Partial cap rate Rate at which to give partial cap points for area captures 0.1 Note: Use Changelevel normally for the property "Play all round before changelevel" if you are designing a single-stage payload level. Round Entities Next, an entity must be set up for each round in a round-based payload map. Note: This entity is unnecessary for a single-stage payload level.
